text: The Examiner is the daily newspaper of eastern Jackson County, Missouri, including Independence, Blue Springs and Grain Valley. It is published five days a week – Tuesday through Saturday – and its webpage is at www.examiner.net. The Examiner was first published as a weekly newspaper in 1898 by Col. William Southern. The daily edition began publication as The Independence Examiner May 16, 1905. The official Examiner website was launched in 1996. The paper was formerly owned by Stauffer Communications, which was acquired by Morris Communications in 1995.Morris Communications buys Stauffer Communications Morris sold the paper, along with 13 others, to GateHouse Media in 2007.Morris Publishing Completes Sale of Publications to GateHouse Media Audrey Stubbart, an American centenarian, worked for The Examiner until the age of 104. ==References== Examiner [Independence], 27 June 2006: 4A. ==External links== * Official Examiner Website * Mondo page * Morris subsidiary profile of The Examiner Category:Newspapers published in Missouri Category:Jackson County, Missouri Category:Publications established in 1898 Category:1898 establishments in Missouri Category:Gannett publications
title: The Examiner (Missouri)
